messages.message:
Hey team, could do with some help understanding what's going on here (I am really pushing my understanding of file types, downloads and Instabase back end...). As per this (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1749011949485549) thread - I wanted to understand how sub-document file sizes stack up against the original uploaded file.

In this (https://nab.internal.instabase.com/review/c5957170-f80d-491a-9736-cfeae6622c36) run I uploaded a 20MB document. Post-processing we generate:
• A PDF image link here (https://nab.internal.instabase.com/nab/hamish.campbell.nabpov_instabase.com/fs/Instabase%20Drive/app-runs/57fc4f4e-ba2f-4f76-90b6-1244a29efaf9/49697560-2601-4863-998e-355b1348ef19/s1_process_files/images/test.pdf_p0.JPEG.JPEG). This seems to be a replica of the originally uploaded file and when downloaded from the file system it is 34MB
    ◦ I don't understand why this is bigger than the original 20MB
    ◦ What's causing this increase and how would it scale? Is it related to the number of pages or some other deterministic operation?
• Links to each individual sub-document e.g. here https://nab.internal.instabase.com/nab/hamish.campbell.nabpov_instabase.com/fs/Instabase%2[…]pply_classifier/generated/test.pdf.pdf.Passport-1-1.pdf (https://nab.internal.instabase.com/nab/hamish.campbell.nabpov_instabase.com/fs/Instabase%20Drive/app-runs/57fc4f4e-ba2f-4f76-90b6-1244a29efaf9/49697560-2601-4863-998e-355b1348ef19/s3_apply_classifier/generated/test.pdf.pdf.Passport-1-1.pdf)
    ◦ Sub-documents all add up to the 34 MB which makes sense
    ◦ Biggest increase seems to come from page sizes. E.g. highest page documents are the biggest files by some distance

Perhaps there is also an easy way to compress the size back down as a post-processing step outside of IB? Again I'm not sure what we are doing to inflate the size and if this would even be possible without lowering quality
